coded_answer.p: I'm writing this letter to you to make a complaincomplaint about the "Over the rainbowRainbow" musical showmusical show "Over the Rainbow" which I saw yesterday. I have to say that I'm very disappointed with what I saw because byafter seingseeing your advertismentadvertisement I expected more. ThatThe show was entirely different to what it says onin the advertismentadvertisement .
I arrived at the theatre at 19:30, found my seat and waited for forty-five minutes, with two hundred other people, for the show to start.

When it finally started I noticed that the famous actor Danny Brook was replacedhad been replaced by someone who was not as good as him. Danny Brook was the reason that most people came to see the show. After some time, a few of them started to leave the theatre. I was a little more portientpatient so I stayed to watch the holewhole show, which by the way was the worst I hadhave ever seen. I don't know why I payedpaid Â£20 with no discountsdiscount, aswhich the advertisements said itI woulwould have. Then I thougtthought that I should go to the theatre restaurant to have a drink or eat something so that I couldn't say that I wastedhad wasted my time by coming here. I became furious when I saw that it was closed because there weren't any employees to workdo the work.

So, I went home as fast as I could to write you this letter. I don't care what you will dodo about the theatre but I want my money back because this wasn't the perfect evening out you promised it would be.

TheFor the last forty years, technology has been growing very fast. firstFirst it was used only by the military or by scientists but for the last twenty years modern technology ishas been found in any house, rich or poor, and it helps people do hard work.
Most houses have many electric devices like a microwave machine, an oven, a mixer, a dish washerdishwasher and many other things which can do a job byat the press of a button.

TheIn the last ten yearyears computers had enteredhave entered almost every house, especially in rich countryscountries. CompetersComputers entirely changedhave entirely changed peoplepeople's lives. Children can play games on itthem or watch a film. There are millions of things you can do with a computer. You can listen to music and generally use it for fun but the primary reason that computercomputers were invented was for communication. There are hundretshundreds of progransprograms which help you communicate with your cousin in Australia or with a complete stranger whichwho you wannawant to meet. Millions of people use computers for this reason.

The general conclusion about computers is that they help people to have easier lives by doing hard work and helping them. They are important to people who like to have fun with games and they are, maybe the best way to communicate with someone you know or a person you want to meet.
